Or , one may use alternative kinds of education to

from high school using homeschooling , and/or take classes at a junior college while finishing high school -- as ways to advance .

This may be about children working at or above grade level who are bored -- or , conversely , those below grade level who may be repeating a grade , for one reason or another , without learning anything new .
Another possibility is that the public school lessons do not go well with your religious or political beliefs .

If your school does n't offer a special gifted/talented class ( or when you think that 's not good enough ) you can
homeschool
your child and others ' children , by setting up an private alternative kind of school .

For small starters , your living room should do it , but depending on the number of children it may not be practical for you or for them .
Maybe someone 's garage could be a good option if they do n't own a car or maybe a rented space ( depending on how many children you intend to enroll in the school one room may be enough ) .
Get the basic supplies .
These would be for the average classroom a table for each student with a chair ( or maybe a big table with chairs all around ) and a separate desk with chair for the teacher(s) .
You may want also a bookcase to keep the students ' text books , tests and record their progress and keep their files and worksheets .
A cork bulletin board for notes ( such as announcements , for field trips and lunch menu , etc. ) and a white/chalk board will also come in handy .
